page.title: 15Carlton Towers
page.content: The three storey house,19th century Victorian,is now a popular tourist attraction. Originally the Carlton Hall of l6l4 was Jacobean style, but in the late l9th Century the famous architect Pugin redesigned the interior to Victorian period. In the outer hall the mosaic ceiling panels and French style cabinets show the old furniture at its best. Marble steps lead between elephantine piers to the inner hall. Many portraits which hang in the picture gallery were chosen by Ethel Beaumont. There are two state bedrooms with magnificent walnut furniture. The oak staircase leads to a room where in a cupboard a loose floorboard reveals the entrance to a priest's hiding hole, where many priests hid during the reformation.
